    The structure used to provide a buffering layer over the IMC. More...

    A description of the services available on a channel. More...

    The encapsulation of all the data necessary for an RPC connection, either client or server. More...

Detailed Description

A simple remote procedure call API.

To use this API, include <nacl/nacl_srpc.h> and link with the srpc library.

Define Documentation

#define NACL_SRPC_GET_TIMES_METHOD   0xfffffffe

RPC number for "implicit" timing method.

#define NACL_SRPC_MAX_ARGS   128

The maximum number of arguments per SRPC routine.

#define NACL_SRPC_MAX_SERVICE_DISCOVERY_CHARS   4000

The maximum number of characters returnable from service discovery.

#define NACL_SRPC_METHOD ( entry_format,
method_handler   ) 

Value:

struct NaClSrpcHandlerDesc \
  __attribute__((section(".nacl_rpc_methods"))) \
  __attribute__((aligned(8))) \
  NaClSrpcMethod##method_handler = \
  { entry_format, method_handler }
Exports a method to the default RPC descriptor array.

Parameters:
entry_format a string with the format "x:y:z", where x is the method name, * y is the parameter type list, and z is the return value type list.
method_handler A function pointer for the implementation of the method.

#define NACL_SRPC_TOGGLE_CHANNEL_TIMING_METHOD   0xfffffffd

RPC number for "implicit" timing control method.

#define STRINGZ_TO_SRPCARG ( val,
arg   ) 

Value:

do { \
    (arg).tag = NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_STRING; \
    (arg).u.sval = (val); } while (0)
A utility macro to set a string-typed argument.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum NaClSrpcArgType

Type tag values for NaClSrpcArg unions.

Enumerator:
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_INVALID  invalid type
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_BOOL  scalar bool
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_CHAR_ARRAY  array of char
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_DOUBLE  scalar double
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_DOUBLE_ARRAY  array of double
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_HANDLE  a descriptor (handle)
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_INT  scalar int
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_INT_ARRAY  array of int
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_STRING  NUL-terminated string.
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_OBJECT  scriptable object
NACL_SRPC_ARG_TYPE_VARIANT_ARRAY  array of NaClSrpcArg structs

enum NaClSrpcResultCodes

Result codes to be returned from Simple RPC services.

Enumerator:
NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK  Invocation was successful.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_BREAK  Invocation was successful, exit the server dispatch loop.

When returned from an RPC method, this causes the server to return NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK and then exit the receive-dispatch-reply loop.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_MESSAGE_TRUNCATED  Some or all of a message was not received.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_NO_MEMORY  The SRPC runtime system ran out of memory.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_PROTOCOL_MISMATCH  The SRPC message layer detected a protocol version difference.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_BAD_RPC_NUMBER  The RPC number was not valid for any method.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_BAD_ARG_TYPE  An unknown type was passed to or returned from an RPC.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_TOO_FEW_ARGS  Too few arguments were passed to or returned from an RPC.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_TOO_MANY_ARGS  Too many arguments were passed to or returned from an RPC.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_IN_ARG_TYPE_MISMATCH  One or more input argument types did not match the expected types.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OUT_ARG_TYPE_MISMATCH  One or more output argument types did not match the expected types.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_INTERNAL  An unknown SRPC internal error occurred.

NACL_SRPC_RESULT_APP_ERROR  The application signalled a generic error.

Function Documentation

int NaClSrpcClientCtor ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
NaClSrpcImcDescType  imc_desc 
)

Constructs an SRPC client object communicating over an IMC descriptor.

Clients issue RPC requests and receive responses.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to be constructed.
imc_desc The NaClSrpcImcDescType describing the IMC channel to communicate over.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

void NaClSrpcCommandLoop ( NaClSrpcService *  service,
NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
NaClSrpcInterpreter  interpreter,
NaClSrpcImcDescType  default_socket_address 
)

The interpreter loop used by sel_universal and non-embedded applications.

It runs a loop that reads from stdin, and invokes the specified command interpreter. As the interpreter may need to know either the service or channel on which it needs to run, these are also specified. To provide access to at least one valid transferrable descriptor, we pass the default socket address descriptor for the NaCl module.

void NaClSrpcDtor ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel  ) 

Destroys the specified client or server channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel to be destroyed.

char* NaClSrpcErrorString ( NaClSrpcError  error_val  ) 

Returns a descriptive string for the specified NaClSrpcError value.

Parameters:
error_val A NaClSrpcError to be translated to a string.
Returns:
If error_val is valid, returns a string. Otherwise returns the string "Unrecognized NaClSrpcError value"

void NaClSrpcGetTimes ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
double *  send_time,
double *  receive_time,
double *  imc_read_time,
double *  imc_write_time 
)

[Either Side] Gathers the microsecond-granularity timing results retained for the specified channel.

If timing is not enabled, this function sets all _time parameters to 0.0.

Parameters:
channel A channel descriptor.
send_time The time spent in sending via this channel.
receive_time The time spent in receiving via this channel.
imc_read_time The time spent waiting for IMC layer reads via this channel.
imc_write_time The time spent waiting for IMC layer writes via this channel.
See also:
NaclSrpcToggleChannelTiming()

NaClSrpcError NaClSrpcInvoke ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
uint32_t  rpc_num,
  ... 
)

[Client Side] Invokes a specified RPC on the given channel.

Parameters are passed by stdarg conventions and determined from the types specified in the method tables stored in channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to use to invoke the RPC.
rpc_num The index of the RPC to be invoked.
Returns:
A NaClSrpcResultCodes indicating success (NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK) or failure.
See also:
NaClSrpcResultCodes

NaClSrpcError NaClSrpcInvokeByName ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
const char *  rpc_name,
  ... 
)

[Client Side] Invokes a specified RPC on the given channel.

Parameters are passed by stdarg conventions and determined from the types specified in the method tables.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to use to invoke the RPC.
rpc_name The name of the RPC to be invoked.
Returns:
A NaClSrpcResultCodes indicating success (NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK) or failure.
See also:
NaClSrpcResultCodes

NaClSrpcError NaClSrpcInvokeV ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
uint32_t  rpc_num,
NaClSrpcArg *  args[],
NaClSrpcArg *  rets[] 
)

[Client Side] Invokes a specified RPC on the given channel.

Parameters are passed in arrays and are type-checked against the types specified in the method tables stored in channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to use to invoke the RPC.
rpc_num The index of the RPC to be invoked.
args The array of parameter pointers to arguments to be passed in.
rets The array of parameter pointers to arguments to be returned.
Returns:
A NaClSrpcResultCodes indicating success (NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK) or failure.
See also:
NaClSrpcResultCodes

NaClSrpcError NaClSrpcInvokeVaList ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
uint32_t  rpc_num,
va_list  in_va,
va_list  out_va 
)

[Client Side] Invokes a specified RPC on the given channel.

Parameters are passed in and returned through pointers to stdargs. They are type-checked against the types specified in the method tables stored in channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to use to invoke the RPC.
rpc_num The index of the RPC to be invoked.
in_va The pointer to stdargs list of arguments to be passed in.
out_va The pointer to stdargs list of arguments to be returned.
Returns:
A NaClSrpcResultCodes indicating success (NACL_SRPC_RESULT_OK) or failure.
See also:
NaClSrpcResultCodes

int NaClSrpcServerCtor ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
NaClSrpcImcDescType  imc_desc,
NaClSrpcService *  service,
void *  instance_data 
)

Constructs an SRPC server object communicating over an IMC descriptor.

Servers wait for RPC requests, dispatch them to implementations, and return responses.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor to be constructed.
imc_desc The NaClSrpcImcDescType describing the IMC channel to communicate over.
service A NaClSrpcService structure describing the service handled by this server.
instance_data A value to be stored on the channel descriptor for conveying data specific to this particular server instance.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

int NaClSrpcServerLoop ( NaClSrpcImcDescType  imc_socket_desc,
const struct NaClSrpcHandlerDesc  methods[],
void *  instance_data 
)

Runs an SRPC receive-dispatch-respond loop on the specified NaClSrpcImcDescType object.

Parameters:
imc_socket_desc A NaClSrpcImcDescType object that RPCs will communicate over.
methods An array of NaClSrpcHandlerDesc structures describing the set of services handled by this server.
instance_data A value to be stored on the channel descriptor for conveying data specific to this particular server instance.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

Destroys an SRPC service object.

Parameters:
service The service to be destroyed.

int NaClSrpcServiceHandlerCtor ( NaClSrpcService *  service,
const NaClSrpcHandlerDesc *  handler_desc 
)

Constructs an SRPC service object from an array of handlers.

Parameters:
service The service to be constructed.
imc_desc handler_desc The handlers for each of the methods.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

NaClSrpcMethod NaClSrpcServiceMethod ( const NaClSrpcService *  service,
uint32_t  rpc_number 
)

Obtains the function pointer used to handle invocations of a given method number.

Parameters:
service The service to be searched.
rpc_number The number of the rpc to be looked up.
Returns:
On success, a pointer to the handler; on failure, NULL.

uint32_t NaClSrpcServiceMethodCount ( const NaClSrpcService *  service  ) 

Obtains the count of methods exported by the service.

Parameters:
service The service to be examined.
Returns:
The number of methods exported by the service.

uint32_t NaClSrpcServiceMethodIndex ( const NaClSrpcService *  service,
char const *  name 
)

Obtains the index of the specified RPC name.

Parameters:
service The service to be searched.
name The exported name of the method.
Returns:
A non-negative index if the name was found in the channel's set of methods. If the name was not found, it returns kNaClSrpcInvalidMethodIndex.

int NaClSrpcServiceMethodNameAndTypes ( const NaClSrpcService *  service,
uint32_t  rpc_number,
const char **  name,
const char **  input_types,
const char **  output_types 
)

Obtains the name, input types, and output types of the specified RPC number.

Parameters:
service The service to be searched.
rpc_number The number of the rpc to be looked up.
name The exported name of the method.
input_types The types of the inputs of the method.
output_types The types of the outputs of the method.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

void NaClSrpcServicePrint ( const NaClSrpcService *  service  ) 

Prints the methods available from the specified service to stdout.

Parameters:
service A service.

int NaClSrpcServiceStringCtor ( NaClSrpcService *  service,
const char *  service_discovery_string 
)

Constructs an SRPC service object from a service discovery string.

Parameters:
service The service to be constructed.
imc_desc handler_desc The string returned from a service discovery call.
Returns:
On success, 1; on failure, 0.

void NaClSrpcToggleChannelTiming ( NaClSrpcChannel *  channel,
int  enable_timing 
)

[Either Side] Enables or disables timing of the specified channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel descriptor whose timing to consult.
enable_timing If zero, disable timing. Otherwise, enable timing.
See also:
NaClSrpcGetTimes()

void srpc_init (  ) 

[Server Side] Initializes the SRPC system, setting up the command channel and preparing the graphics subsystem for embedding in the browser.
